alert.note: Alert for Clarke; Frederick; Page; Shenandoah; Warren (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued September 07 at 2:10PM EDT by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flash flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...A portion of northwestern Virginia, including the following areas: Clarke, Frederick, Page, Shenandoah, and Warren. * WHEN...Until 4 PM EDT this afternoon. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Slow-moving showers and thunderstorms producing very heavy rainfall rates may result in several instances of flash flooding through late afternoon. - Please visit https://www.weather.gov/safety/flood for flood safety and preparedness information.
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be prepared to take action should Flash Flood Warnings be issued.
